ResearchProjectDef.label: The Superpod
ResearchProjectDef.description: Slap a few Orbital Relay Launch Modules onto a traditional transport pod and Voilà! You've got a ship capable of return flight! It's just a first step, though.

ResearchProjectDef.label: The Skip
ResearchProjectDef.description: This vessel design was conceived after a nearby colony on this world tried their own version of a superpod. They decided to dismantle the pods and put them together uniquely. It turned out quite well, and has since become a popular dedsign due to its cheap material cost and reliable transport capabilities. \n\nHas military potential.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: Building a shuttle is expensive and time consuming, but absolutely worth the cost.\n\nYou will find your ship blueprints under the SHIP tab, in your architech menu.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Ship Components
ResearchProjectDef.description: Through intense study of the Skip, it was found that ships could be built more efficiently if they were assembled in stages. Who would've thought?
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: You've unlocked the ability to craft your own ship parts!\n\nBuild the ship components necessary to craft your vessels in a Fabrication Bench, or buy them from traders.

ResearchProjectDef.label: The SRAF
ResearchProjectDef.description: A large aerial transport freighter. We don't know the history of these ships, but we do know they're found everywhere on the homeworlds. What it lacks on in chemfuel mileage and speed, it makes up for with it's vast cargo hold.

ResearchProjectDef.label: The Drop Ship
ResearchProjectDef.description:
A large aerial transport freighter. The TEK-7 class space-faring ship is rather new. It's powered by classical means, but uses modern technology to achieve more than it's predecessors.

Terra Enclave Kingdrone - 7th Variation, Year 4186. This class has seen much combat, through many model variations each specialized in specific roles. 

TEK-7 is designated as a transport carrier.

ResearchProjectDef.label: The Albatross
ResearchProjectDef.description: The Albatross X-11 was originally designed for military exoplanetary exploration, but was quickly replaced by a newer ship model with a much better engine system. You can find X-11 parts across the galaxy at typically low prices. It's natural design could easily be changed for atmospheric flight. \n\n Definitely has military potential.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: You can now build an additional type of component needed for more powerful ships: neuromesh plates. While you do not yet need them, you will for the next tier of ships. Build them at a Fabrication bench.

ResearchProjectDef.label: The Phoenix
ResearchProjectDef.description:
After years of research we finally discovered something special: a new technique originally used by an exctinct alien civilization used in the process of ship making.

This process infuses the ship with a "mystical" neuromesh technology while using fewer materials in the build. The new model is light, spacious, and hauls serious ass compared to the Albatross.

The schematics show serious military capability.

ResearchProjectDef.label: The Pelican
ResearchProjectDef.description: Devoid of all military dressing, the Pelican is basically a Mk. III that's been retroverted into a cargo and transport vessel. Still utilizing the superior technology discovered recently, this ship is lighter, faster, and far more powerful than anything previously known.

ResearchProjectDef.label: The Genesis
ResearchProjectDef.description: The SRTS Mk.4: Genesis is a highly advanced transport shuttle that utilizes uranium for fuel. Utilizing Archotech technology, it's cargo space seems to extend beyond it's physical boundaries. This is "Blue box" level stuff.\n\nSome of the technologies contained within this vessel seem to defy all known laws of physics. We need to get our hands on them.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: A few of the components needed to build the Genesis elude you. You don't think you can craft them yourself being how complicated they are. At least not yet.\n\nFor now, buy the more advanced components from traders or as quest rewards to build the Genesis.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Archotech Ship Components
ResearchProjectDef.description: Through careful deliberation by the greatest minds on our planet, we think we've figured out how to build the revolutionary components necessary to construct the mythical Genesis.
